LGTM. 

The implementation can not support  all structures but at least it can meet the requirement at present

我测试了2.7.7这个兼容并没有效果，看了下2.6.6的代码是这样兼容的
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6935924/112637517-379aa200-8e79-11eb-9a2d-c45b0b3c03aa.png)

我们也遇到了，服务注册中心是nacos1.2.1，dubbo版本是2.7.5。
A调用B服务多次（连续调用），前几次都成功了，突然就直接抛这个异常出来，我们只有provider设置15秒超时，从A日志看抛异常的这次调用，从调用B开始耗时不到300ms就异常了。
更新一下：应该是B服务被kill了，我们测试脚本没有考虑操作系统启动A服务的耗时，结果A还是启动过程中就把B服务给重启了。（我们在测试B服务重启对A的影响）

let me have a look.

> Dubbo does not build on ARM64 due to dependencies which use native binaries, like embedded-redis and embedded-consul.
> I am going to send a Pull Request with updated versions of those dependencies!

Ok, thank you for your reply, it will be very helpful.

> I think it's not necessary.

Small code optimization, including extracting invariants into static variables, etc.

Can you configure the client parameters on the consumer side to solve this problem?

There seems to be a problem with the stop logic. The Shutdown hook is called by the JVM before the JVM exits. **It is not good to wait for the dubbo shutdown hook to complete in the Spring close event.** Actually Spring also registered shutdown hook, please check org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext#registerShutdownHook().

* In the Spring scenario, perhaps we should listen to Spring events to shut down dubbo instead of using shutdown hook. In this case, the life cycle of dubbo is consistent with spring. 
* In the Dubbo API scenario, the shutdown hook needs to be registered.

Now it is precisely because of the existence of Spring hook and Dubbo Hook. As a result, Spring did not block when closing dubbo, and then continued to execute the destruction of Spring Bean. At this time, Dubbo has not completed the destruction, which will cause the database connection not to be obtained. It may be a way to cancel Dubbo Hook directly after hosting to the Spring container.

like https://github.com/apache/dubbo/pull/7317.

 If the idea of #7317 is used, should the callback be removed from ShutdownHook? ShutDownHook only calls DubboBootstrap.stop to complete the resource wave work.

Repeated scan should be a problem in the implementation logic. There are two ways to register a scanner, one is to annotate `@DubboComponentScan`/`@EnableDubbo`,  and the other is to define the configuration: `dubbo.scan.base-packages` .
A better solution is to register a single scanner (prefer to `ServiceClassPostProcessor`), then collect all the package names to be scanned from the annotations and configuration, filter the duplicate packages and sub-packages, and then scan.

Here is my little suggestion,I just want to keep the code as consistent as possible.
1. The logic of random selection under different weights is consistent with` if (offset <weights[i])` in the last logic of `RandomLoadBalance#doSelect`.
2. The initialization of leastActive is consistent with the two variables `ShortestResponseLoadBalance#shortestResponse `and `RoundRobinLoadBalance#maxCurrent` with the maximum  or minimum value as the initial value.
3. The judgment logic of is `sameWeight` is consistent with the logic of `if (sameWeight && totalWeight != weight * (i + 1)` in RandomLoadBalance.

As for current solution, it just check if service has been registered to `at least one` registries. 

But, while some of the registries, this method will directly return `true`.

My question is whether we should provide a state like `none of the registries has been registered`, `some ( or how many ) of the registries has been registered` and `all of the registries has been registered`.
